denver.utils¶

class denver.utils.config_parser.ConfigParserMultiValues[source]¶

A class to get config from file .ini

denver.utils.config_parser.get_config_section(filename, section)[source]¶

Get config by sestion

Parameters

  • filename – Path to file .ini

  • section – The section to take.

Returns

A dict key, value from this section.

denver.utils.config_parser.get_config_yaml(config_file)[source]¶

This function will parse the configuration file that was provided as a system argument into a dictionary.

Parameters

config_file (Union[str, Path]) – Path to the config file

Returns

A dictionary contraining the parsed config file

denver.utils.utils¶

denver.utils.utils.check_url_exists(txt)[source]¶

Function to check url exists. Return True if exists, otherwise

Parameters

txt – The user’s input.

Returns

True if exists url, otherwise.

denver.utils.utils.convert_to_BIO(entities, text)[source]¶

Function convert entities follow rasa format to BIO.

Parameters

  • entities – Entities rasa format, example: [{‘start’: 8, ‘end’: 23, ‘value’: ‘30x35x(38-50)cm’, ‘entity’: ‘ask_confirm#size’, ‘confidence’: 0.9999693632125854, ‘extractor’: ‘FlairSequenceTagger’}].

  • text – Raw text, example: Có size 30x35x(38-50)cm ko Shop.

Returns

BIO format: BIO format, example: O O B-ask_confirm#size O O.

denver.utils.utils.convert_to_denver_format(examples)[source]¶

Function to convert data with json format of Rasa to dataframe format of Denver

Params examples

Data with json format of Rasa

Returns

data_df: Returns data with dataframe format of Denver.

denver.utils.utils.download_url(url, dest, name, overwrite=False)[source]¶

Download the model from url and save it to dest with the name is name

Parameters

  • url (str) – The url to download

  • dest (str) – The directory folder to save

  • name (str) – The name file to save

  • overwrite (bool) – If True, overwrite the old file.
